intro: Couepia racemosa var. reticulata, commonly known as the reticulate couepia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves with a distinctive reticulate venation pattern. It produces clusters of small, fragrant white flowers, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
